definition: to suffer the painful loss of (a loved one etc)/to miss out on (an opportunity)/to fail to gain (victory etc)

sentences.english: They take a day of sick leave rather than admit to being off because of pet bereavement.
sentences.chinese: 他们宁可请病假而不愿承认因为痛失宠物而请假。

sentences.english: He lost his gold medal because of his illness.
Visiting his daughter's home, he added the loss left him "speechless".
sentences.chinese: 查看了女儿的寓所，他说痛失女儿令他“无言以对”。

sentences.english: Many are bereft at the mall’s demolition, as though suffering the death of a pet.
sentences.chinese: 随着商场的拆毁，好多随之失去，如同痛失爱宠。

sentences.english: I'd really hate to lose him.
Indecision can also result in missed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 优柔寡断还可以导致痛失良机。

sentences.english: She was benumbed with grief at the death of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她因痛失丈夫而伤心得发呆。

sentences.english: He at that period ought only the daddy pain lost to adore wife, expected to him that only having is higher.
sentences.chinese: 他那时候只当爹爹痛失爱妻，对他期望只有更高。

sentences.english: Their daughter Kimberly also felt the loss of her sister.
sentences.chinese: 他们的女儿金伯莉也痛失姊妹。

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to meet with disaster/to die tragically
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to lose Jingzhou due to carelessness (idiom)/to suffer a major setback due to negligence
to die young or prematurely/to come to a premature end/to be aborted prematurely
to hold a funeral procession and burial/to give sb a final send-off/(fig.) to ruin (one's future prospects etc)
